Get a list of open orders for a product. The amount of detail shown can be customized with the level parameter.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The product id (e.g. BTC-USD)

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: The order book level (1, 2, or 3)

uris.description: Get the ticker for a product.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The product id (e.g. BTC-USD)

uris.description: Get a list of the latest trades for a product.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The product id (e.g. BTC-USD)

uris.description: Get historical candle data for a product. The maximum number of data points for a single request is 300 candles. If your selection of start/end time and granularity will result in more than 300 data points, your request will be rejected. If you wish to retrieve fine granularity data over a larger time range, you will need to make multiple requests with new start/end ranges.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The product id (e.g. BTC-USD)

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: ISO 8601 start time

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: ISO 8601 end time

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: The granularity field must be one of the following values: {60, 300, 900, 3600, 21600, 86400}

uris.description: Get 24 hr stats for the product. volume is in base currency units. open, high, low are in quote currency units.

parameters.name: product_id
parameters.description: The product id (e.g. BTC-USD)

endpoints.name: CoinMarketCap
endpoints.description: CoinMarketCap is the world's most trusted cryptocurrency data aggregator.

uris.description: Get latest cryptocurrency listings

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The offset for the start (1-based index)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results to return. Use this parameter and the start parameter to determine your own pagination size.

parameters.name: convert
parameters.description: Return price, 24h volume, and market cap in terms of another currency. Valid values are: BTC, ETH, USD, CAD, EUR, GBP, JPY, KRW, RUB, TRY, AUD, BRL, CHF, CLP, CNY, CZK, DKK, HKD, HUF, IDR, ILS, INR, MXN, MYR, NOK, NZD, PHP, PKR, PLN, SEK, SGD, THB, TWD, ZAR

uris.description: Get latest cryptocurrency quotes

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of cryptocurrency platform IDs. Example: 1,2,3

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of cryptocurrency slugs. Example: bitcoin,ethereum

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of cryptocurrency symbols. Example: BTC,ETH

parameters.name: convert
parameters.description: Return price, 24h volume, and market cap in terms of another currency. Valid values are: BTC, ETH, USD, CAD, EUR, GBP, JPY, KRW, RUB, TRY, AUD, BRL, CHF, CLP, CNY, CZK, DKK, HKD, HUF, IDR, ILS, INR, MXN, MYR, NOK, NZD, PHP, PKR, PLN, SEK, SGD, THB, TWD, ZAR

uris.description: Get historical cryptocurrency quotes

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of cryptocurrency platform IDs. Example: 1,2,3

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of cryptocurrency slugs. Example: bitcoin,ethereum

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of cryptocurrency symbols. Example: BTC,ETH

parameters.name: time_start
parameters.description: A timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to start returning historical quotes for. Example: 1417411980 or 2014-12-01T12:00:00

parameters.name: time_end
parameters.description: A timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to stop returning historical quotes for. Example: 1417411980 or 2014-12-01T12:00:00

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: The number of historical quotes to return. Example: 10

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: The interval between each historical quote. Example: 1h

parameters.name: convert
parameters.description: Return price, 24h volume, and market cap in terms of another currency. Valid values are: BTC, ETH, USD, CAD, EUR, GBP, JPY, KRW, RUB, TRY, AUD, BRL, CHF, CLP, CNY, CZK, DKK, HKD, HUF, IDR, ILS, INR, MXN, MYR, NOK, NZD, PHP, PKR, PLN, SEK, SGD, THB, TWD, ZAR

uris.notes: The interval parameter must be one of the following: 1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 2h, 6h, 12h, 1d, 1w, 1mo, 3mo

uris.description: Get latest OHLCV (Open, High, Low, Close, Volume) for a currency

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of cryptocurrency platform IDs. Example: 1,2,3

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of cryptocurrency slugs. Example: bitcoin,ethereum

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of cryptocurrency symbols. Example: BTC,ETH

parameters.name: convert
parameters.description: Return price, 24h volume, and market cap in terms of another currency. Valid values are: BTC, ETH, USD, CAD, EUR, GBP, JPY, KRW, RUB, TRY, AUD, BRL, CHF, CLP, CNY, CZK, DKK, HKD, HUF, IDR, ILS, INR, MXN, MYR, NOK, NZD, PHP, PKR, PLN, SEK, SGD, THB, TWD, ZAR

parameters.name: time_period
parameters.description: The time period to return OHLCV data for. Example: 1d

uris.notes: The time_period parameter must be one of the following: 1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 2h, 6h, 12h, 1d, 1w, 1mo, 3mo

parameters.description: Return price, 24h volume, and market cap in terms of another currency. Valid values are: BTC, ETH, USD, CAD, EUR, GBP, JPY, KRW, RUB, TRY, AUD, BRL, CHF, CLP, CNY, CZK, DKK, HKD, HUF, IDR, ILS, INR, MXN, MYR, NOK, NZD, PHP, PKR, PLN, SEK, SGD, THB, TWD, ZAR

parameters.name: time_period

parameters.description: A timestamp (Unix or ISO 8601) to start returning historical OHLCV data for. Example: 1417411980 or 2014-12-01T12:00:00
